revised_title: Exploring the Genetic Basis of Viral Virulence
tldr: This article discusses the genetic basis of viral virulence, focusing on the role of multiple genes in determining the pathogenicity of viruses. The study uses animal models and genetic analysis to understand the role of viral components, such as the haemagglutinin, in determining virulence. The research highlights the importance of understanding the genetic and molecular determinants of viral pathogenicity for developing effective treatments and vaccines.
